nodes.bodyText: This is an anti pattern. You should never need to do this as Locale.getDefault picks up the settings from the JVM.
or even more so get it from the PreferencesService
final Locale loc = StringUtils.isNotBlank(userId) ? preferencesService.getLocale(userId) : Locale.getDefault();

Sorry I've been neglecting this PR review 👍
Why are you bothering to create a new locale object here? You have it already at line 67.

Good point, Adrian.
I've made and tested the correction.
Thank you.
You can use GetMapping here. Bit simpler.

Hi,
Thank you. I've made the change to GetMapping.
